headline.main: CHIEF OF BOMBERS RESCUES HIS CREW; Saunders Crashes Plane Near Island in Solomons After Pilots Are Blasted NATIVES AID SURVIVORS Navy Plane and Ship Get the Colonel and Others Back to Guadalcanal Base

lead_paragraph: AN ADVANCED SOUTH PACIFIC AIR BASE, Nov. 20 (Delayed) -- By the grace of God, his own quick thinking and the sturdiness of his Flying Fortress, Colonel La Verne Saunders, commander of an Army bombing group that has been giving the Japanese what-for in the South Pacific since last July, came back to the land of the living today.
abstract: Col L Saunder's rescue after crash landing plane near Jap outpost described

byline.original: By FOSTER HAILEYSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES
